ranked_diseases.explanation: Presents with all three features: nystagmus, reduced visual acuity, and macular atrophy. This is a classic presentation of cone-rod dystrophy affecting central vision.
Most common juvenile macular dystrophy presenting with macular atrophy and reduced visual acuity. Nystagmus can occur secondarily due to poor central vision.
Early-onset severe retinal dystrophy with nystagmus and severely reduced visual acuity. Macular atrophy can develop over time.
Congenital color blindness with nystagmus, reduced visual acuity, and can have macular changes. Complete lack of cone function leads to these symptoms.
Multisystem disorder with retinal dystrophy causing macular atrophy and vision loss. Nystagmus can occur. Would expect additional systemic features.
Macular dystrophy with reduced visual acuity and macular changes. Nystagmus is less common but can occur with significant vision loss.
X-linked disorder with nystagmus and reduced visual acuity. Macular atrophy is less typical but can occur in some cases.
